actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the Journal of the proceedings of the Senate was deemed approved to date.
Pursuant to the order of yesterday, the morning hour being deemed expired, and the times for the recognition of the two leaders being reserved.
The following transactions of morning business occurred on today.

S.Res. 600 (Sen. Whitehouse):
        A resolution recognizing January 2026 as "National Mentoring Month".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Res. 601 (Sen. Heinrich):
        A resolution designating the week beginning February 2, 2026, as "National Tribal Colleges and Universities Week".

        -- Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.


 S.Con.Res. 25 (Sen. Gillibrand):
        A concurrent resolution recognizing the 15th anniversary of the January 8, 2011, Tucson, Arizona, shooting and honoring the survivors and victims, including former Congresswoman Gabby Giffords, a gun violence survivor and one of the most influential voices of courage in the United States in the fight to end gun violence.

        -- Senate Committee on the Judiciary discharged by Unanimous Consent.

        -- Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.

PN621:
        Vice Adm. Thomas G. Allan, Jr., in the Coast Guard, to be Admiral

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN675:
        2 nominations in the Coast Guard beginning with Jarod M. Ross and ending with Andrew R. Younkle

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN676:
        11 nominations in the Coast Guard beginning with Jonathan B. Bernhardt and ending with Ryan S. Townsend

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN677-1:
        82 nominations in the Coast Guard beginning with Michael Adams and ending with Dewey W. Worker

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN682:
        2 nominations in the Coast Guard beginning with Margaret A. Harward and ending with Jennifer A. Rogers

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN697:
        2 nominations in the Coast Guard beginning with James M. Hurtt and ending with Kelli A. Knight

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN698:
        Michelle J. Moravek, in the Coast Guard, to be Lieutenant Commander

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Voice Vote.


 PN726-4:
        Daniel E. Burrows, of Colorado, to be an Assistant Attorney General

        -- Motion to proceed to executive session to consideration of nomination agreed to in Senate by Voice Vote.

        -- Cloture motion presented in Senate.


 PN726-9:
        Brian Charles Lea, of Tennessee, to be United States District Judge for the Western District of Tennessee

        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 46. Record Vote Number: 30 



 PN726-11:
        Justin R. Olson, of Indiana, to be United States District Judge for the Southern District of Indiana

        -- By unanimous consent agreement, mandatory quorum required under Rule XXII waived.

        -- Cloture invoked in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 51 - 47. Record Vote Number: 31 


        -- Considered by Senate.

        -- Confirmed by the Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 50 - 47. Record Vote Number: 32

Under the authority of the order of today, at  2:54 p.m, the Presiding Officer (Mr. Moreno in the chair) declared the Senate adjourned, under its order of today, until  3 p.m. on Monday, February 9, 2026.
